TEXT.Spanish: Van en aumento las tensiones entre Gran Bretaña y Nueva Francia, situada alrededor del río Ohio, que no ha sido hollado por el hombre en un siglo y, por ello, cuenta con abundante caza. En medio de esta tormenta en ciernes, casi 3.000 indios shawnee y lenape (o "delaware") han conseguido una gran baza comercial con el intercambio de pieles por armas y otras mercancías.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Aunque es posible que el desarrollo de los hechos difiera de la historia real, como gobernador de Nueva Francia o mayor con 21 años de experiencia en el ejército británico, tus acciones pueden ser el detonante de un conflicto internacional a gran escala.

TEXT.English: Carve your fortune from the Crossroads of the World!
TEXT.French: Amassez des fortunes dans le Carrefour des civilisations !
TEXT.German: Bestimmen Sie Ihr eigenes Schicksal in Crossroads of the World!
TEXT.Italian: Ricava la tua fortuna dai crocevia del mondo!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Labra tu fortuna en la encrucijada del mundo!

TEXT.English: The year is 1300. European traders have caught the sweet waft of spices from the East, and the craving for the goods of the Orient has become an epidemic. China, for the first time in their history, has sent out trading vessels to establish contact with the West. Indian storehouses spill over with finery. It is a trader's age and you stand at the Crossroads of the World.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Features:[NEWLINE]Commerce Victory[NEWLINE]This new victory requires players to accumulate wealth through any means necessary. Taxes, pillaging, conquest or trade - the means matter not, only that in the end, you have the deepest coffers. Ten new Corporations are among the many features that will let players engage in unprecedented economic warfare.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Raiders[NEWLINE]These lightning-quick cavalry bear no markings of nationality, allowing players to pillage the lands of friends and foes alike.
TEXT.French: Nous sommes en l'an 1300. Les marchands européens s'enivrent de la douce odeur des épices de l'Est et les ressources de l'Orient exercent une fascination grandissante sur les occidentaux. Pour la première fois de son histoire, la Chine a envoyé des navires commerciaux afin d'établir un contact avec l'Ouest. Les entrepôts indiens débordent de biens précieux. C'est l'âge d'or du commerce, l'aube d'un nouveau monde.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Particularité :[NEWLINE]Victoire commerciale[NEWLINE]Cette nouvelle victoire oblige les joueurs à accumuler un maximum de richesse par tous les moyens nécessaires. Taxes, pillages, conquête ou échanges commerciaux - peu importe la manière, pourvu que vos coffres soient bien garnis. Dix nouvelles sociétés commerciales apparaissent dans cette partie qui entraînera les joueurs dans une guerre économique sans précédent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pillards[NEWLINE]Ces cavaliers vifs comme l'éclair ne portent aucune marque de nationalité, permettant aux joueurs de piller indifféremment les territoires amis et ennemis.
TEXT.German: Wir schreiben das Jahr 1300. Europäische Händler haben den süßen Duft der Gewürze des Ostens gerochen und das Verlangen nach den Waren aus dem Osten verbreitet sich rasend schnell. China hat zum ersten Mal in der Geschichte Handelsschiffe ausgesandt, um Kontakt mit dem Westen herzustellen. Indische Lagerhäuser quellen über vor lauter Prachtwaren. Es ist ein Zeitalter des Handels, und Sie stehen am Scheideweg der Welt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Features:[NEWLINE]Wirtschaftssieg[NEWLINE]Dieser neue Sieg erfordert, dass der Spieler so viel Wohlstand wie möglich anhäuft, egal mit welchen Mitteln. Steuern, Plünderungen, Eroberungen oder Handel - am Ende zählt nur, dass Sie den größten Reichtum angehäuft haben. Unter den zahlreichen neuen Features gibt es zehn neue Kapitalgesellschaften, die den Spieler in eine bespiellose wirtschaftliche Kriegsführung eintauchen lassen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Räuber[NEWLINE]Diese blitzschnelle Kavallerie trägt kein Zeichen ihrer Nationalität, wodurch sie es dem Spieler ermöglicht, gleichermaßen bei Feinden und Freunden zu plündern.
TEXT.Italian: L'anno è il 1300. I commercianti europei hanno colto il soave effluvio di spezie provenienti dall'Est, e il desiderio di beni dell'Oriente si è sparso a macchia d'olio. La Cina, per la prima volta nella sua storia, ha inviato navi mercantili per stabilire un contatto con l'Occidente. I magazzini indiani traboccano di eleganza. È un periodo di scambi, e tu ti trovi al Crocevia del mondo.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Caratteristiche:[NEWLINE]Vittoria commerciale[NEWLINE]Questa vittoria richiede di accumulare ricchezza con ogni mezzo. Tasse, saccheggi, conquiste o commercio, non contano i mezzi, solo il fine, avere i forzieri più capienti e più pieni. Tra le numerose nuove caratteristiche ci sono dieci nuove Corporazioni che permetteranno guerre economiche senza precedenti.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Razziatori[NEWLINE]Questa cavalleria rapida non ha indicazioni di nazionalità, e permette ai giocatori di saccheggiare le terre di alleati e nemici, senza distinzioni.
TEXT.Spanish: Corre el año 1300. Los comerciantes europeos se han visto atrapados por los dulces efluvios de las especias de Oriente y la sed por las mercancías orientales se ha convertido en una fiebre. China, por primera vez en su historia, ha enviado barcos mercantes para entrar en contacto con Occidente. Los almacenes hindúes desbordan esplendor. Se trata de una era de comerciantes y te encuentras en la encrucijada del mundo.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Características:[NEWLINE]Victoria comercial[NEWLINE]Esta nueva victoria precisa que los jugadores acumulen riqueza por todos los medios necesarios. Impuestos, pillaje, conquista o intercambio; no importa la manera si al final tienes las arcas más llenas que nadie. Entre las diversas características que permiten a los jugadores enzarzarse en una guerra económica sin precedentes hay diez nuevas corporaciones.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Bandidos[NEWLINE]Estas raudas unidades de caballería no llevan ningún pabellón, por lo que permiten a los jugadores saquear los territorios de amigos y enemigos por igual.

TEXT.English: Bravado and luck, buddy. Bravado and luck.
TEXT.French: De la vantardise et de la chance ! C'est tout nous !
TEXT.German: Mut und Glück, Kumpel. Mut und Glück.
TEXT.Italian: Coraggio e fortuna, amico. Coraggio e fortuna.
TEXT.Spanish: Suerte y valor, colega. Suerte y valor.

TEXT.English: The sun rises on the year %s1_year. Since time immemorial, the %s2_civ people have lived a nomadic life. After years of wandering, they are ready to settle down and found your first city. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]%s3_leader, your people have vested absolute power in you, trusting that you can build a Civilization to stand the test of time!
TEXT.French: Le soleil se lève sur l'an %s1_year. Depuis des temps immémoriaux, les %s2_civ vivent en nomades. Après des années d'errance, ils sont prêts à s'installer et à fonder votre première ville. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]%s3_leader, votre peuple vous a confié le pouvoir absolu et s'en remet à vous pour bâtir une civilisation qui résistera à l'épreuve du temps !
TEXT.German: Die Sonne erhellt das Jahr %s1_year Das %s2:3_civ Volk führt seit uralter Zeit ein Nomadenleben. Doch nun, nach so vielen Jahren des Umherziehens, sind die Menschen bereit, sich niederzulassen und Eure erste Stadt zu gründen. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]%s3_leader, Euer Volk hat Euch absolute Macht verliehen und vertraut darauf, dass Ihr eine Zivilisation errichtet, welche die Zeit überdauern wird!
TEXT.Italian: Il sole sorge nell'anno %s1_year. Da tempi immemori, la popolazione %s2:2_civ ha condotto una vita nomade. Dopo anni di vagabondaggi, sono infine pronti a stabilirsi e a fondare la tua prima città. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]%s3_leader, il tuo popolo ti ha conferito potere assoluto, credendo che tu possa sviluppare una civiltà in grado di resistere alle prove del tempo!
TEXT.Spanish: El sol se alza en el año %s1_year. Desde tiempos inmemoriales, los %s2:3_civ han llevado una vida nómada. Tras años de deambular, están listos para asentarse y fundar vuestra primera ciudad. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]%s3_leader, vuestro pueblo os ha conferido poder absoluto, confiando en que podáis desarrollar una civilización que supere los retos del tiempo.

TEXT.German: Nein, denken wir noch mal nach ...

TEXT.English: Build your city. Brace your troops. And be prepared for an unending onslaught of opponents.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A Civ mod with a beat 'em up mentality, Defense plants you in the middle of 20 levels of endless enemies. Slaughter your foes and earn gold to buy more troops to fortify your position. Only by using your wits can you hope to succeed. Because numbers just aren't on your side.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Features:[NEWLINE]Your Own Personal Battlefield[NEWLINE]Using the Advanced Start system, players may customize their defenses in order to stop their foes dead in their tracks. Use ranged units to obliterate enemies from afar or get up close and personal using specialized melee warriors. Earn gold for cities left at the end of each wave to further insulate yourself from their ever more deadly attacks.
TEXT.French: Construisez votre ville. Consolidez vos troupes. Et soyez prêt à résister aux incessantes vagues d'assauts lancées par vos ennemis.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Axé sur un thème résolument guerrier, Défense vous fait lutter contre 20 niveaux d'ennemis bien décidés à avoir votre peau. Massacrez vos ennemis et gagnez de l'or pour acheter des troupes et fortifier vos positions. Puisque les statistiques sont contre vous, seule la ruse vous permettra de vaincre.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Particularités :[NEWLINE]Votre propre champ de bataille[NEWLINE]Grâce au système de démarrage avancé, les joueurs peuvent transformer leurs défenses afin de stopper net leurs ennemis. Utilisez vos unités de combat à distance pour anéantir vos ennemis tout en restant à l'abri, ou flanquez-leur une bonne raclée en vous servant de puissants guerriers spécialisés dans le combat rapproché. Gagnez de l'or pour chaque ennemi tué afin de vous préserver de leurs attaques toujours plus mortelles.
TEXT.German: Errichten Sie Ihre Stadt. Bauen Sie Ihre Truppen auf. Und seien Sie bereit für nie endende Angriffe Ihrer Gegner.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Defense ist ein Civilization-Mod mit Beat 'em up-Charakter und versetzt Sie in 20 Level, in denen es vor Gegnern nur so wimmelt. Schalten Sie Ihre Gegner aus und verdienen Sie Gold, um mehr Truppen zu kaufen und Ihre Position zu stärken. Sie können nur gewinnen, wenn Sie Ihren Verstand einsetzen - zahlenmäßig sind Sie hoffnungslos unterlegen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Features:[NEWLINE]Ihr eigenes persönliches Schlachtfeld[NEWLINE]Mit dem Fortgeschrittenen Start können Spieler ihre Verteidigung anpassen, um die Pläne ihrer Feinde zu vereiteln. Löschen Sie den Gegner mit Fernkampf-Einheiten aus der Distanz aus oder erledigen Sie das mit spezialisierten Nahkampf-Kriegern persönlich aus der Nähe. Jeder besiegte Gegner bringt Ihnen Gold ein, welches Sie auch benötigen, um sich gegen die immer tödlicher werdenden Angriffe zu wappnen.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci la tua città. Rinforza le truppe. E preparati a un massacro senza fine dei tuoi avversari.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Un mod pensato con in mente i picchiaduro, Defense ti piazza nel bel mezzo di 20 livelli pieni zeppi di nemici. Massacrali e guadagna oro con cui comprare nuove truppe e fortificare la tua posizione. La tua unica speranza di successo sta nella tua astuzia. Perché i numeri non sono proprio dalla tua parte.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Caratteristiche:[NEWLINE]Il tuo campo di battaglia personale[NEWLINE]Sfruttando il sistema di Avvio avanzato, i giocatori possono personalizzare le proprie difese in modo da arrestare l'avanzata dei nemici. Usa le unità a lungo raggio per annientare i nemici più lontani, o mettila sul piano personale coinvolgendo le unità da mischia. Guadagna oro per ogni nemico ucciso per proteggerti ancor di più dagli attacchi inferti dai tuoi avversari.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye tu ciudad, refuerza las tropas y prepárate para una interminable ofensiva de rivales.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Defense", un mod de civilizaciones con una mentalidad aplastante, te planta en medio de 20 niveles de enemigos sin fin. Masacra a tus enemigos y gana oro para comprar más tropas y hacerte fuerte. El ingenio es tu única esperanza para triunfar. Porque los números no están de tu parte.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Características:[NEWLINE]Tu propio campo de batalla personal[NEWLINE]Gracias al sistema de inicio avanzado, los jugadores pueden personalizar sus defensas para dejar al enemigo muerto en el camino. Usa unidades de largo alcance para aniquilar a los enemigos a distancia o hazlo de cerca y en persona con guerreros de combate cuerpo a cuerpo. Gana oro por cada muerte para aislarte gradualmente de sus ataques, que cada vez serán más mortíferos.

TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_BLUE]Si dispone di un patto di difesa[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Removing a %s1 near your city of %s2 has created %d3 [ICON_GOLD] for your treasury.
"We don't want to deal with the unhappiness."
TEXT.French: "Nous ne voulons pas traiter avec le malheur."
TEXT.German: "Wir haben keine Lust, uns Unzufriedenheit einzuhandeln."
TEXT.Italian: "Non vogliamo avere a che fare con il malumore del popolo."

TEXT.German: "Ganz so nah stehen wir Euch dann eigentlich doch nicht."

TEXT.French: "Nous ne trahirons pas nos plus fidèles amis !"
TEXT.German: "Es würde uns nie in den Sinn kommen, enge Freunde zu hintergehen!"
TEXT.Italian: "Non potremmo mai tradire i nostri più cari amici!"
TEXT.Spanish: "¡No podríamos traicionar a nuestros amigos del alma!"

TEXT.English: "We'd love to, but you'll have to contact them..."
TEXT.French: "Ce serait avec plaisir, mais vous devez les contacter..."
TEXT.German: "Das würden wir gern tun, aber Ihr müsst Kontakt zu ihnen aufnehmen ..."
TEXT.Italian: "Ci piacerebbe, ma non li abbiamo mai incontrati..."
TEXT.Spanish: "Nos encantaría, pero tendréis que contactar con ellos..."

TEXT.English: "That would go against everything we stand for!"
TEXT.French: "Cela irait à l'encontre de tous nos principes !"
TEXT.German: "Das würde gegen alle unsere Grundsätze verstoßen!"
TEXT.Spanish: "¡Eso iría contra todo por lo que luchamos!"

TEXT.English: "Too few of our people follow that faith..."
TEXT.French: "Trop peu de nos citoyens ont adopté cette religion..."
TEXT.German: "Zu wenige unserer Bürger folgen diesem Glauben..."
TEXT.Italian: "Troppe poche persone seguono la nostra fede..."
TEXT.Spanish: "Muy pocos de los nuestros siguen esa fe..."

TEXT.English: "You'll have to take it from our cold, dead hands."
TEXT.French: "Il faudra d'abord nous passer sur le corps !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Nos lo arrebataréis por encima de nuestro cadáver."

TEXT.English: "We haven't had a defensive pact or shared a war for long enough."
TEXT.French: "Nous n'avons pas signé de pacte de défense ou combattu ensemble depuis assez longtemps.'"
TEXT.German: "Wir haben lange genug kein Verteidigungsbündnis geschlossen oder sind gemeinsam in den Krieg gezogen."
TEXT.Italian: "Non abbiamo avuto un'alleanza difensiva o combattuto una guerra insieme da troppo tempo."
TEXT.Spanish: "No hemos firmado un acuerdo de protección ni guerreado el tiempo suficiente."

TEXT.English: Making peace with our enemies is out of the question
TEXT.French: Il est hors de question de faire la paix avec nos ennemis
TEXT.German: Eine Versöhnung mit unseren Feinden ist völlig ausgeschlossen
TEXT.Italian: Fare pace coi nostri nemici è fuori questione
TEXT.Spanish: Firmar la paz con nuestros enemigos es inconcebible

TEXT.English: Making peace with your enemies is not possible for you
TEXT.French: Il vous est impossible de faire la paix avec vos ennemis
TEXT.German: Ihr könnt mit Euren Feinden nicht Frieden schließen
TEXT.Italian: Non ti è possibile fare pace coi tuoi nemici
TEXT.Spanish: Firmar la paz con vuestros enemigos no es posible para vos

TEXT.German: "Wir haben mächtigen Respekt vor ihrer militärischen Stärke."

TEXT.French: "Nous nous en sortons très bien seuls."
"Vous êtes devenu trop puissant pour nous."
TEXT.German: "Ihr seid zu mächtig für uns geworden."
TEXT.Spanish: "Os habéis hecho demasiado poderosos para nosotros."

TEXT.English: We are afraid of your enemies!
TEXT.French: Nous avons peur de vos ennemis !
TEXT.Italian: I tuoi nemici ci fanno paura!

TEXT.English: "Not right now... maybe we'll change our mind in a few years."
TEXT.French: "Pas pour l'instant... mais nous pourrions changer d'avis dans quelques années...'"
TEXT.German: "Das ist ein schlechter Zeitpunkt ... Vielleicht ändern wir unsere Meinung ja in ein paar Jahren."
TEXT.Italian: "Non ora... Forse cambieremo idea tra qualche anno."
TEXT.Spanish: "Ahora no... Quizá cambiemos de idea en unos años."

TEXT.English: "We don't want to start trading away this technology just yet."
TEXT.French: "Nous ne souhaitons pas échanger cette technologie pour l'instant."
TEXT.German: "Wir finden es noch zu früh, mit dieser Technologie zu handeln."
TEXT.Spanish: "Aún no queremos empezar a comerciar con esta tecnología."

TEXT.English: "We fear you are becoming too advanced."
TEXT.French: "Nous craignons que vous preniez trop d'avance dans votre essor technologique."
TEXT.German: "Wir haben die Befürchtung, dass Ihr zu fortschrittlich werdet."

TEXT.English: Your land is too far away
TEXT.German: Euer Reich ist zu weit entfernt.
TEXT.Italian: Il tuo territorio è troppo lontano

TEXT.English: "We have enough on our hands right now."
"Sorry... we're not willing to trade this."
TEXT.French: "Je regrette... nous ne souhaitons pas échanger ceci."
TEXT.German: "Wir haben leider kein Interesse, damit zu handeln."

TEXT.English: Sorry, it's out of our hands.
TEXT.French: Désolé, cela ne nous concerne plus.
TEXT.German: Es liegt leider nicht in unserer Hand.
TEXT.Spanish: Lo sentimos, no está en nuestras manos.

TEXT.English: "We'd rather win the game, thank you very much..."
TEXT.German: "Wir haben eigentlich vor, das Spiel zu gewinnen! Besten Dank ..."
TEXT.Italian: "Ci piacerebbe vincere la partita, grazie lo stesso..."

TEXT.English: Joining the war on your side is not possible for us
TEXT.French: Nous ne pouvons pas nous battre à vos côtés
TEXT.German: Wir können in diesem Krieg nicht auf Eurer Seite kämpfen.
TEXT.Italian: Non possiamo scendere in guerra al tuo fianco
TEXT.Spanish: No nos es posible unirnos a la guerra en vuestro bando.

TEXT.English: Joining the war on our side is not possible for you
TEXT.French: Vous ne pouvez pas vous battre à nos côtés
TEXT.German: Ihr könnt in diesem Krieg nicht auf unserer Seite kämpfen.
TEXT.Italian: Non puoi scendere in guerra al nostro fianco
TEXT.Spanish: No es posible que os unáis a la guerra en nuestro bando.

TEXT.English: "We will never trade with you, our worst enemy!!!"
TEXT.French: "Jamais nous ne ferons commerce avec notre pire ennemi !!!"
TEXT.German: "Ihr seid unsere ärgsten Feinde! Wir werden niemals Handel mit Euch treiben!!!"
TEXT.Italian: "Non tratteremo mai con voi, siete i nostri peggiori nemici!"
TEXT.Spanish: "¡Nunca negociaremos con vosotros, nuestros peores enemigos!"

TEXT.German: %s1_player ist beschäftigt. Versuchen Sie es später noch mal.
TEXT.Spanish: %s1_player no está disponible. Intentadlo más tarde.

TEXT.English: Who do you want to contact?
The server has broken our connection.
TEXT.French: Le serveur a interrompu notre connexion.
TEXT.German: Der Server hat die Verbindung getrennt.
TEXT.Italian: Il server ha interrotto la nostra connessione.
TEXT.Spanish: El servidor ha interrumpido la conexión.

TEXT.English: We have been disconnected from the server due to an unspecified error.
TEXT.French: Nous avons été déconnectés du serveur. Erreur non spécifiée.
TEXT.German: Die Verbindung zum Server wurde wegen eines unbekannten Fehlers getrennt.
TEXT.Italian: Siamo stati disconnessi dal server a causa di un errore non specificato.
TEXT.Spanish: Se ha producido la desconexión del servidor debido a un error no especificado.

TEXT.English: It is the year 1776 AD. Discontent with foreign domination, the people in the American colonies have risen up in revolution to found their own nation. However, their fledgling republic is still in danger of being reclaimed by European colonial powers and has to surpass its former masters to fulfill its manifest destiny.

It is the year 622 AD. The founding of Islam unites the Arabian people under the banner of the Caliphate. Arabia's direct neighbors, the Byzantine Empire and Sassanid Persia, are weakened from their recent wars. It is the right time to expand the House of Islam into their wealthy possessions, forming a melting pot of cultures that will bring culture and science to new heights.

It is the year 1810 AD. Spurred by the weakness of the Spanish Empire and the ideals of the French Revolution, the people in the Viceroyalty of the Rio de la Plata have overthrown their viceroy and started a revolution to form the Argentine Republic.

It is the year 1700 AD. Despite the setbacks during the Thirty Years War, the victory at the Siege of Vienna allowed the Habsburg Monarchy to drive back the Turks and secure their holdings in the Balkans. The beginning of the Austrian baroque let arts and architecture flourish, but the weakness of the Spanish line may lead to another war soon ...

It is the year 1195 AD. The Aztec peoples have founded the city of Tenochtitlan at Lake Texcoco in the Valley of Mexico. Through clever use of irrigation systems, Tenochtitlan can become the largest metropolis of Mesoamerica and dominate the surrounding cities.

It is the year 3000 BC. The fertile crescent of Mesopotamia is home of the first urbanized cultures in the history of mankind and known as the cradle of civilization. Though the cities of Sumer and Akkad are thriving, with the emergence of Babylon, they will soon be overshadowed by the greatest metropolis of its time.

It is the year 1822 AD. After the revolution in Portugal threatens Brazilian sovereignty with in the United Kingdom, Dom Pedro of Brazil declares an independent empire. Brazil's rich plantations as well as the Amazon rainforest promise wealth for the future, but also demand preservation.

It is the year 330 AD. With the Roman Empire threatened by Barbarian invasions from the east, it becomes evident that the Empire cannot be governed from Rome alone. So Constantine the Great has founded Constantinopolis as a "New Rome", in hopes that the Eastern Empire will be able to withstand these incursions and eventually restore the glory of the Roman Empire.

It is the year 600 AD. After the death of Justinian, most of his successes have been unmade again. While the Lombards took Northern Italy and the Danube could be barely held against the Slavs, Byzantium was also plunged into a war against Sassanid Persia. Its victory proved Pyrrhic, and now the Empire is economically and militarily weakened.

It is the year 1867. After the American revolution, Canada has remained under colonial control. With the approval of the North America Acts, Canada has now been finally granted independence so it can expand across the Great White North on its own accord.

It is the year 3000 BC. China is the easternmost region of the world where human civilization first develops. Through the dynasties of Xia, Shang and Zhou, cities develop mainly in the vicinity of the Yellow River, and the concept of a "Mandate of Heaven" is invented to legitimize the rule of the Middle Kingdom of China through the ages.

It is the year 1700 AD. After the Ming Dynasty has collapsed under peasant revolts, the Jurchens of Manchuria have conquered China and established the Qing Dynasty. With Manchuria, Xinjiang and Tibet under imperial control, China has reached the greatest extent in history, and the rule of the Kangxi Emperor promises another golden era.

It is the year 600 AD. After the Han Dynasty had collapsed, civil war between the Chinese kingdoms ensued. Only 11 years ago Emperor Wen of Sui managed to reunite China and reclaim the Mandate of Heaven. But the power of the Sui Dynasty is not completely consolidated, and the old challenges of China remain.

It is the year 1390 AD. The Kingdom of Kongo emerges after the unification of several tribal polities in the Congo delta just when European powers start to expand their influence in Africa. It must try to keep its independence by both religious and economic means.

It is the year 1700 AD. Continued warfare with the Portuguese and internal rebellions have weakened the Kingdom of Kongo to the point of effective colonization. The kingdom is still lagging behind scientifically and economically, and often the slave trade remains as the only viable source of income.

It is the year 3000 BC. The Egyptian civilization coalesces under the recent unification of the Kingdoms of Lower and Upper Egypt. The fertile banks of the Nile make Egypt one of the wealthiest regions of the world. It is time to use this wealth to build monuments and establish a culture the world has never seen before.

It is the year 829 AD. After the migration of Germanic peoples to Britain, the island has been divided between several Celtic, Norse and Anglo-Saxon kingdoms. Now the King of Wessex has been crowned Bretwalda and thus ruler of all of England. Now unified, the English people can turn their eyes from their island across the sea and gain rule of the waves.

It is the year 1700 AD. The Glorious Revolution has restored stability to the British thrones and paved the way to the Acts of Union. With its colonial holdings in the Americas and India growing, the British crown will be able to establish a world-wide empire and challenge the French dominance over Europe.

It is the year 295 BC. The Ethiopian highlands are exceptionally fertile due to its temperate climate, but also quite remote from other civilizations. This changes when the major trade routes between the Roman Empire and Indians shift to the Red Sea, allowing the Ethiopian kingdom of Aksum to flourish.

It is the year 751 AD. After the collapse of the Western Roman Empire, the Merovingian Frankish Empire became the major Christian power in Europe. With the coronation of Pepin from the Carolingian dynasty, the Franks have come another step closer to reclaim Rome's legacy and dominate Christian Europe.

It is the year 1700 AD. France under the rule of Louis XIV is at the height of its power and the dominating cultural and military power in continental Europe. After extending its borders and winning the Thirty Years War, the impeding end of the Spanish Habsburgs presents another opportunity to expand French power.

It is the year 1701 AD. Since the Westphalian Peace of 1648, the Holy Roman Empire is nothing but a loose organization of states. While the power of the Emperor concentrates in his Austrian holdings, the Electorate of Brandenburg-Prussia elevated itself to the Kingdom of Prussia, seeking to unite the German nation under its own hegemony.

It is the year 1600 BC. The first city states emerge on the Greek peninsula. While the division of the Greek civilization might seem as a disadvantage at first, their emphasis on independence favors the inception of new ideas in literature, science and philosophy as well as new tactics in the art of warfare.

It is the year 3000 BC. The river beds of the Indus and Sarasvati provide fertile ground for ancient civilization. With unparalleled sanitation and urban planning, the Indus Valley Civilization centered around the city of Harappa can make use of this fertility and become the most widespread and populous civilization of its time.

It is the year 843 AD. The Treaty of Verdun brings the final separation of the Frankish Empire into West and East Francia. The eastern half is dominated by German peoples, and not only would its German kings break with the Romantic Frankish culture, but also claim its imperial title and the continuation of the Holy Roman Empire.

It is the year 1150 AD. Manco Capac has just founded the Kingdom of Cuzco, the first Incan kingdom. Even in the harsh environment of the Andes and lacking suitable pack animals, they set out to create an empire never seen before in the Americas.

It is the year 1500 BC. After the collapse of the Harappan civilization, the Vedic Aryans reach the Indo-Gangetic plain. The following Vedic era features the development of a caste system and the Mahajanapada kingdoms, where the most important epics of Indian culture are authored, laying the foundation to transform India into the religious and spiritual center of the world.

It is the year 1700 AD. Sixteen years ago, Shivaji Bhosle has established the Maratha Kingdom, the first Hindu state to challenge Mughal hegemony over Northern India. With Mughal power declining, now is the time to break Muslim domination of the subcontinent for good.

It is the year 700 AD. Nearly all of the trade between China and India passes the Strait of Malacca. Benefiting from its position on the nearby island of Sumatra, the Indonesian Kingdom of Srivijaya rises to become a major trading power in Southeast Asia.

It is the year 1167 AD. For too long has Italy been under the rule of German kings, but now the Lombard cities have risen up and thanks to Papal support, achieved de facto independence. The Italian city states, though often feuding with each other, are centers of science, culture and commerce and can now reap the benefits of their skills to usher in a Renaissance of European culture.

It is the year 525 AD. The early Japanese polity centered around the Yamato province is introduced to Buddhism from Korea. This allows the spread of Chinese influences from the Sui and Tang dynasties to Japan, followed by a centralization of power into the Empire of Japan.

It is the year 1700 AD. Under the Tokugawa Shogunate, Japan has been at peace for almost a century now. But contact with European traders threatens to disturb the achieved balance again, and even the complete seclusion under the Sakoku cannot preserve it forever. Japan will have to open itself to the world ...

It is the year 600 AD. The early Japanese polity centered around the Yamato province is introduced to Buddhism from Korea. This allows the spread of Chinese influences from the Sui and Tang dynasties to Japan, followed by a centralization of power into the Empire of Japan.

It is the year 655 AD. The unpredictable nature of the South East Asian monsoons have so far prevented the formation of a developed civilization in the region. But now, the advanced Khmer water management techniques lead to the foundation of their capital Angkor, facilitating enormous population growth and urbanization.

It is the year 50 BC. The three Korean kingdoms of Silla, Baekje and Goguryeo form on the Korean peninsula, the first step of centralization of power away from their predecessor chiefdoms. The Chinese are close; Korea will have to have to adapt their more advanced organization without abandoning its own sovereignty.

It is the year 1700 AD. The Kingdom of Joseon has faced both invasion from Japan and the Manchu, who now control the entire Chinese Empire. Now a period of relative peace and economic and cultural renaissance has begun, but with two powerful neighbors and Western imperialism on the rise, it can only last for so long ...

It is the year 600 AD. The three Korean kingdoms still thrive and Goguryeo has expanded the influence of Korean civilization into Manchuria. But now that China is reunited again, they have to be careful to protect their independence for the future.

It is the year 989 AD. Sub-Saharan Africa is still underdeveloped compared to the rest of the old world. But the Mande people control rich gold mines, which has caught the attention of its northern neighbors. Defending against foreign attempts to seize its riches by force, Mali has now the opportunity to truly become the richest civilization on Earth.

It is the year 60 AD. Urbanization on the peninsula of Yucatan sparks the formation of the Mayan city states, whose technological and architectural advancements would create the first advanced civilization in the Americas.

It is the year 1190 AD. For centuries, the peoples of the Mongolian steppe were too divided to pose an actual threat to the world. Now that Temujin has managed to unify all Mongolian tribes under his command, everything has changed, and soon both Orient and Occident will tremble in fear before his armies.

It is the year 711 AD. The Berbers and Arabs of the Maghreb have crossed the Strait of Gibraltar and defeated the Visigoths to establish the Emirate of Cordoba in Al-Andalus, driving the Iberian Christians to the northern coast of Asturias.

It is the year 1206 AD. Although Muslim rulers have occasionally raided India for centuries, the foundation of the Delhi Sultanate by Muhammad of Ghor marks the establishment of Islam as a political power on the subcontinent. Their successors, including the Muslim Mughal dynasty, would spread their faith all over India and erect its greatest architectural wonders since ancient times.

It is the year 1700 AD. The Mughal Empire has reached its zenith. While culture and architecture are still thriving, Mughal hegemony over India is threatened by the emergence of a sovereign Hindu state in the Marathas and the gains of various European powers on India's coasts.

It is the year 1581 AD. Situated at the confluence of Europe's most important trade routes, the Netherlands are the most populated and wealthiest region of the continent. Far too long this wealth has gone to foreign powers, but now, after long wars, the Dutch people have finally reached independence and established a Republic.

It is the year 1700 AD. Since their independence at the end of the Eighty Years war, the Netherlands have entered a Golden Age and become the European center of trade, industry, culture and science. This wealth however has created envy in the rising neighboring powers of France and Great Britain, and the Dutch will need to keep their colonial empire together to maintain their wealth.

It is the year 844 BC. Persia has always been home to warlike peoples, but now the Achaemenid dynasty provides them with the unifying force to form an organized empire. While the Persian plateau is not particularly wealthy, it has rich and defenseless neighbors in India in the east and Mesopotamia in the west to conquer on their way to become the world's greatest empire.

It is the year 1700 AD. The Safavid Dynasty, which has ruled Persia since 1500 AD, is losing authority over its territory. The time is ripe for a competent warlord to seize control and humiliate the neighboring Turks, Uzbeks and Mughals ...

It is the year 1200 BC. Foreign invasions have weakened the Mesopotamian kingdoms, allowing the Phoenician city states to achieve independence. With the neighboring lands dominated by more powerful civilizations, the Phoenicians have turned their eyes to the west, seeing the opportunity to gain wealth by trade on the Mediterranean Sea.

It is the year 1025 AD. After the Christianization of the West Slavs in 966, the first Polish ruler is coronated as king. Fertile lands promise urban growth, while pagan neighbors to the north and declining Orthodox polities to the east offer opportunities for expansion.

It is the year 1700 AD. Cossack uprisings and the Swedish deluge have severely weakened the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, and the decentralized political system is incapable of reform. Encircled by the growing powers of Prussia, Austria and Russia, the very independence of Poland is in danger ...

It is the year 1000 BC. Polynesian settlers have migrated to the Tongan and Samoan islands. With their exceptional navigational skills, they can reach and settle even the most isolated islands in the South Pacific Ocean around them.

It is the year 1128 AD. Portugal has just defeated Spain and gained independence. Situated at the western end of Europe, the kingdom is in an excellent position to send ships to ports all over the world and control the trade of all of Europe, Africa and Asia.

It is the year 1700 AD. In the last century, Portugal has regained its independence from the Spanish crown. Many of its colonial possessions have been lost to the Dutch, but Brazil is still under Portuguese control and promises wealth for the future.

It is the year 753 BC. The Latin people have just founded the city of Rome. Situated at a favorable position and governed by a superior political system, it is fated to control the whole Italian peninsula. Most of its neighboring regions in Europe are still barbaric and uncivilized. The city of Carthage is its only rival on the way to rule and civilize the whole Mediterranean.

It is the year 860 AD. Varangian travelers among the amber road between Scandinavia and Byzantium begin to set up states along their routes. Quickly mingling with their Slavic subjects, they would become the Rus and set out to settle the vast areas of Eastern Europe and beyond.

It is the year 1700 AD. Under the rule of Peter the Great Russia is on the path of modernization. Sweden has just been defeated and the foundation of Sankt-Peterburg secured a window to the east for Russia. With the advance into Siberia, the Russian Empire is now the largest in the world.

It is the year 718 AD. Arabs from the Ummayad Caliphate have overrun almost all of Iberia and put an end to Visigoth rule. Now the Spanish Kingdom of Asturias is founded in the mountainous north, seeking to restore Christian control over Iberia and expand it beyond.

It is the year 1700 AD. The Spanish Empire is in a state of decline. Income from the American colonies is diminishing, the cultural flourishing of the last century has come to an end, and now the ruling Habsburg dynasty is about to die out. The conflict over the Spanish succession is about to consume Europe ...

It is the year 1700 AD. The Kingdom of Sweden is the most formidable of the Scandinavian powers and has managed to establish an empire by acquiring Finland. Still, its expansion has also created enemies, and rivals like Denmark-Norway, Poland and especially Russia might seek to curb Swedish power ...

It is the year 300 BC. With the development of their Sangam literature, the Tamil culture rises to the south of India. Their position close to both China and Rome as well as the availability of valuable spices have made the local dynasties of the Cheras, Pandyans and Cholas affluent centers of trade.

It is the year 1700 AD. Since the decline of the Vijayanagara Empire in the 16th century, the Kingdom of Mysore has been the dominant power in the southern Deccan, resisting Mughal expansion. With the appearance of the Marathas and the British, the power structure in India has shifted, requiring Mysore to defend its sovereignty again.

It is the year 1350 AD. The collapse of the Khmer Empire has allowed the Thai people to claim hegemony over South East Asia. They were able to raze the Khmer capital of Angkor and found their own kingdom west of it, in Ayutthaya.

It is the year 1700 AD. With excellent relations with the new European powers in South Asia and controlling one of the largest cities in the world, the Kingdom of Ayutthaya is in an advantageous condition. However, the threat from their Burmese neighbors is beginning to grow and even the Europeans might consider colonization ...

It is the year 630 AD. The Tibetan clans around Lhasa have been united, and the current weakness of the neighboring Chinese Tang and Indian Pala empires opens the opportunity to expand your empire from the Tibetan highlands and spread Buddhist teaching in the whole world.

It is the year 1280 AD. After the collapse of the Seljuk Empire, the Anatolian Turks are divided into several small Beyliks. However, Byzantium is weakened itself, and now that the Osmanli Beylik is in the hands of a strong leader, a Turkish Ottoman Empire seems close. With the Bosphorus right within their grasp, they have the opportunity to form an empire that stretches over three continents.

It is the year 1700 AD. With the defeat at the Siege of Vienna, the military expansion of the Ottoman Empire has come to an end and it is on the defensive against the growing power of Austria and Russia. This change in the balance of power leads to increased cultural contact and exchange with the Europeans and a flowering of Ottoman culture.

It is the year 551 AD. The scarcity of food makes the inhabitants of Scandinavia excellent sailors that rely on fishing and trade. Their home kingdoms still can't sustain further population growth, and the Vikings have to turn to lands across the sea. Not only the coasts of the North Sea, but also the Mediterranean and even the New World make good targets for plunder or settlement.

It is the year 600 AD. The scarcity of food makes the inhabitants of Scandinavia excellent sailors that rely on fishing and trade. Their home kingdoms still can't sustain further population growth, and the Vikings have to turn to lands across the sea. Not only the coasts of the North Sea, but also those of the Mediterranean and even the New World make good targets for either plunder or settlement.

TEXT.Spanish: Esperando a que los interlocutores completen la transferencia del mapa

TEXT.French: Sauvegarder la partie en cours et continuer le jeu.

TEXT.French: Nous attendons que %s1_Names se reconnecte à la partie.[NEWLINE]Si vous voulez mettre fin à l'attente, demandez un vote sur la poursuite des opérations.

TEXT.German: Warten auf erneute Spielverbindung von %s1_Names. Wählen Sie, wie Sie fortfahren wollen, wenn Sie nicht länger warten wollen.

TEXT.Spanish: Esperando que se reanude la conexión a la partida de %s1_Names. Si no quieres seguir esperando, vota acerca de cómo proceder.

TEXT.Spanish: Guardar la partida y seguir más tarde

La votación ha de ser unánime.

TEXT.French: Les joueurs ont voté pour la poursuite de l'attente.

TEXT.Italian: I giocatori hanno scelto di continuare ad aspettare.
TEXT.Spanish: Los jugadores han decidido seguir esperando.

TEXT.French: Nombre d'unités actuellement à votre charge
TEXT.Spanish: Número de unidades que se abastecen actualmente

TEXT.French: Vous devez saisir une adresse e-mail valide.

TEXT.Italian: Devi inserire un indirizzo e-mail valido.
TEXT.Spanish: Hay que introducir una dirección válida de correo electrónico.
Se ha enviado sin problemas el e-mail a %s1.

TEXT.English: A %s1 embassy has been established in
TEXT.French: Une ambassade %s1:2 a été établie à
TEXT.German: Es wurde eine %s1 Botschaft errichtet, und zwar in
TEXT.Spanish: El imperio %s1 ha abierto una embajada en

TEXT.English: Typically the governor will try to meet your demands while allowing for some growth to continue in the city. Select this option to indicate that growth should be avoided with all focus being on the appropriate emphasis.
TEXT.French: Le gouverneur essaiera toujours de satisfaire vos désirs, mais sans pénaliser la croissance de la ville. Choisissez cette option pour stopper toute croissance de la ville pendant qu'elle se concentre sur autre chose.
TEXT.German: Normalerweise versuchen Statthalter, Ihre Forderungen zu erfüllen und die Stadt gleichzeitig zu vergrößern. Wählen Sie diese Option, wenn Sie das Wachstum vernachlässigen und sich auf das Wesentliche konzentrieren möchten.
TEXT.Italian: In genere, i governatori cercheranno di soddisfare le tue richieste, permettendo comunque una leggera crescita delle città. Seleziona questa opzione per indicare che bisogna evitare la crescita e per concentrare tutti gli sforzi sugli ordini appropriati.
TEXT.Spanish: Normalmente, el gobernante intentará cumplir vuestras exigencias permitiendo que, a la vez, la ciudad siga creciendo a menor velocidad. Seleccionad esta opción para indicarle que prescinda del crecimiento y se concentre en lo que hagáis hincapié.

TEXT.English: Select this to have a city obtain high levels of commerce (gold) each turn. Commerce translates into gold which allows you to research, expand, and build your empire.
TEXT.French: Favoriser le commerce (or) dans la ville à chaque tour. Génère l'or qui finance vos recherches et l'expansion de votre empire.
TEXT.German: Konzentrieren Sie sich auf die Wirtschaft (Gold) einer Stadt. Investieren Sie das erwirtschaftete Gold anschließend in die Forschung und die Vergrößerung Ihres Imperiums.
TEXT.Italian: Seleziona questo comando per ottenere a ogni turno grandi quantità di commercio (oro) nella città selezionata. Il commercio viene trasformato in oro, necessario per compiere ricerche, espandersi e costruire il tuo impero.
TEXT.Spanish: Seleccionad esto para hacer que la ciudad obtenga grandes cantidades de comercio (oro) cada turno. El comercio se traduce en oro, lo que os permite investigar, así como expandir y construir vuestro imperio.

TEXT.English: Select this to have a city obtain high levels of food (bread) each turn. Food is necessary to help cities gain population.
TEXT.French: Favoriser la production de nourriture (pain) dans la ville à chaque tour. Indispensable à la croissance de votre population.
TEXT.German: Konzentrieren Sie sich auf die Nahrungsproduktion (Brot). Ausreichend Nahrung ist für das Bevölkerungswachstum entscheidend.
TEXT.Italian: Seleziona questo comando per ottenere a ogni turno grandi quantità di cibo (pane) nella città selezionata. Il cibo è necessario per aiutare l'aumento della popolazione nelle città.
TEXT.Spanish: Seleccionad esto para hacer que la ciudad obtenga grandes cantidades de alimentos (panes) cada turno. Los alimentos son necesarios para que se incremente la población de las ciudades.

TEXT.English: Select this to have the city focus on creating a great person. The governor will use specialists to try and create a Great Person as quickly as possible.
TEXT.French: Choisissez cette option pour que la ville se concentre sur la création d'un personnage illustre. Le gouverneur utilisera les spécialistes à sa disposition pour le créer aussi vite que possible.
TEXT.German: Konzentrieren Sie sich auf die Schaffung Großer Persönlichkeiten. Der Statthalter der Stadt setzt in diesem Fall Spezialisten ein, um möglichst schnell eine Große Persönlichkeit hervorzubringen.
TEXT.Italian: Seleziona questo comando per concentrare al massimo gli sforzi della città sulla realizzazione di un Grande Personaggio. Il governatore cercherà di utilizzare degli specialisti per tentare di realizzare il più velocemente possibile un Grande Personaggio.
TEXT.Spanish: Seleccionad esto para hacer que la ciudad se concentre en crear un gran personaje. El gobernante usará a los especialistas para que intenten crear un gran personaje lo más rápidamente posible.

TEXT.English: Select this to have a city obtain high levels of production (hammers) each turn. Focusing the city on production will slow growth but ensure that the cities are producing as quickly as possible.
TEXT.French: Favoriser la production (marteaux) dans la ville à chaque tour. Sa croissance sera plus lente, mais la construction aussi rapide que possible.
TEXT.German: Konzentrieren Sie sich auf die Produktion (Hämmer). Dadurch wächst Ihre Bevölkerung zwar langsamer, Ihre Städte produzieren allerdings mit maximaler Geschwindigkeit.
TEXT.Italian: Seleziona questo comando per ottenere a ogni turno grandi quantità di produzione (scudi) nella città selezionata. Concentrando gli sforzi della città nella produzione, la crescita demografica verrà ridotta, ma le opere verranno realizzate più rapidamente.
TEXT.Spanish: Seleccionad esto para hacer que la ciudad obtenga grandes cantidades de producción (martillos) cada turno. Centrar una ciudad en la producción hará que crezca lentamente, pero asegura que produzca lo más rápido posible.

TEXT.English: Select this to have a city focus on achieving the highest amount of research possible. This will activate specialists if they are available to help facilitate the city's tech research.
TEXT.French: Favoriser au maximum la recherche dans la ville. Cette action activera les spécialistes disponibles pour l'accélérer.
TEXT.German: Konzentrieren Sie sich auf die Forschung. Dadurch bringen Ihre Städte Spezialisten hervor. Diese beschleunigen die Erforschung von Technologien.
TEXT.Italian: Seleziona questo comando per concentrare al massimo gli sforzi della città sulla ricerca. Così attiverai degli specialisti che, se disponibili, aiuteranno lo sviluppo tecnologico all'interno delle città.
TEXT.Spanish: Seleccionad esto para hacer que la ciudad se concentre en lograr la mayor cantidad posible de investigación. Esto activará a los especialistas, si están disponibles, para ayudar a facilitar la investigación tecnológica de la ciudad.

TEXT.French: Vous venez d'entrer dans une nouvelle ère (%s1_era) !

TEXT.English: You have escaped and regained control of %s1 territory. Now let's teach our enemies a lesson!
TEXT.French: Vous vous êtes échappé et avez regagné le contrôle du territoire %s1. A présent, donnons une leçon à nos ennemis !
TEXT.German: Ihr seid entkommen und habt die Kontrolle über das %s1:3 Gebiet wiedererlangt. Nun sollten wir unseren Feinden eine Lektion erteilen!
TEXT.Italian: Sei riuscito a fuggire e a riguadagnare il controllo del territorio %s1. Ora diamo una bella lezione ai nostri nemici!
TEXT.Spanish: Habéis escapado y recuperado el control del territorio %s1:1. ¡Démosles una lección a nuestros enemigos!

TEXT.English: You have been captured by the %s1:2 and exiled to the unimportant lands of %s2. You have a short period of time for retaking your capital and gain back your position.
TEXT.French: Vous avez été capturé par les %s1 et exilé dans les terres inintéressantes de %s2. Vous avez peu de temps pour reprendre votre capitale et récupérer votre situation.
TEXT.German: Ihr wurdet vom %s1:2 Volk gefangen genommen und seid ins Exil geschickt worden - in das unbedeutende %s2:3 Reich. Es bleibt Euch nur wenig Zeit, um Eure Hauptstadt zurückzuerobern und Eure Position wiederzuerlangen.
TEXT.Italian: Sei stato catturato dai %s1:3 ed esiliato nelle insignificanti terre di %s2. Hai un breve periodo di tempo per riprendere la tua capitale e riguadagnare la tua posizione.
TEXT.Spanish: Habéis sido capturado por los %s1:3 y exiliado a las insignificantes tierras de %s2. Disponéis de un breve periodo de tiempo para recuperar vuestra capital y vuestra posición.

TEXT.English: You have been captured by the
TEXT.French: Vous avez été capturé par les

TEXT.English: and exiled to the unimportant lands of

TEXT.English: Congratulations, the burgeoning %s1Civ_Name now holds One Hundred Million souls! Larger cities allow more citizens and specialists, increasing our productivity!
TEXT.French: Félicitations, la civilisation de l'%s1Civ_Name est en plein essor et compte désormais cent millions d'âmes ! Les grandes villes peuvent abriter plus de citoyens et de spécialistes, ce qui augmente leur productivité !
TEXT.German: Herzlichen Glückwunsch! In der expandierenden Zivilisation %s1Civ_Name leben jetzt einhundert Millionen Einwohner! Größere Städte bieten Platz für mehr Bürger und Spezialisten, die wiederum unsere Produktivität erhöhen!
TEXT.Italian: Congratulazioni, la fiorente città %s1Civ_Name ora contiene cento milioni di abitanti! Le grandi città ospitano più cittadini e specialisti, aumentando la produttività!
TEXT.Spanish: Felicidades, el próspero %s1Civ_Name ya alberga a cien millones de almas. Unas mayores ciudades permiten que haya más habitantes y especialistas, lo que aumenta a su vez la productividad.
